meanings.definition: To extend or stretch out to reach something.
meanings.sent1: I tried to areach the cookie jar on the top shelf.
meanings.sent2: She had to areach for the book on the high shelf.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to areach the dangling toy but kept missing.
meanings.sent4: His ambition was to areach the stars and touch the sky.
meanings.sent5: The tree's branches areached towards the sunlight, eager for its warmth.

meanings.definition: To arrive at or come to a place.
meanings.sent1: After a long journey, they finally areached their destination.
meanings.sent2: The train will areach the station in ten minutes.
meanings.sent3: The lost puppy managed to areach the front porch of a kind neighbor.
meanings.sent4: The news of the victory areached the ears of every villager.
meanings.sent5: The river areached the sea, merging its waters with the vast ocean.

meanings.definition: To make contact with someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I tried to areach my friend on the phone, but she didn't answer.
meanings.sent2: The basketball player areached the ball just in time to score.
